revised_title: Development of the Retina, Optic Nerve, Membranous Labyrinth, and Auditory Nerve
tldr: The author, Henry Gray, studied the development of the retina and optic nerve in chicken embryos, as well as the development of the membranous labyrinth and auditory nerve. The research showed that both the retina and the membranous labyrinth develop as protrusions from the brain, and they share similarities in their structure and development process. This study provides important insights into the anatomy and physiology of the nervous system and the sensory organs.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
